metadata.purpose: Detect metro area data bleeding via ArcGIS organization ID fingerprinting
metadata.methodology: Extract org IDs from services.arcgis.com URLs to identify regional vs city-specific portals

uFAr0LUPy14bDaLg.reason: San Jacinto using Hemet's portal - wrong municipality

xOaE01KwGK9Fvnfr.suspectedSource: San Diego Regional VC or County
xOaE01KwGK9Fvnfr.reason: SDRVC acronym suggests regional/county data, not city-specific

ibgDyuD2DLBge82s.reason: 42 districts for a city that typically has 5-7 suggests regional data

wyoDVuo3QgawYe6R.reason: BPADD suggests regional planning district, 20 wards seems high

suspectedMetroBleeding.evidence: Layer labeled 'County Council Districts' in Political_Districts service
LEE prefix indicates Lee County data
BPADD acronym and 'Municipal_Wards_in_Pulaski_County' suggests county data
'Enriched' prefix suggests derived/aggregated data, 7 districts unusual
42 districts for typical 5-7 district city suggests regional aggregation
53 districts from crime housing layer not authoritative
22 districts for small city extremely unusual

nonSelfHostedPortals.description: Cities using services.arcgis.com instead of their own GIS servers
nonSelfHostedPortals.note: Self-hosted servers (gis.cityname.gov or similar) are more trustworthy than shared ArcGIS Online orgs

comparison.sharedHosting: All failing cities use services.arcgis.com/* pattern indicating shared hosting

quarantine: San Jacinto, CA - Using Hemet data
Walnut, CA - Using West Covina data
Poway, CA - Using San Diego regional data
Jacksonville Beach, FL - Using Jacksonville main city data
Winter Springs, FL - Using regional jurisdiction data (73 districts)
Barberton, OH - Using Summit County data
Goose Creek, SC - Using county data
Bluffton, SC - Using Beaufort County data
Annapolis, MD - Using Anne Arundel County data
Opelika, AL - Using Lee County data
Little Rock, AR - Using regional planning district data
DeQuincy, LA - 22 districts for small city (data quality issue)
investigate: La Cañada Flintridge, CA - Enriched/derived data source
Clovis, CA - 42 districts suggests regional aggregation
Escondido, CA - 53 districts from non-authoritative crime housing layer
Port Arthur, TX - Using rehab map layer not primary council data
Old Westbury, NY - Third-party CitizenServe platform, 6 districts for village
needsCorrectSource: All quarantined cities need authoritative city-specific GIS sources
Priority: CA cities (8 issues), FL cities (2 issues), SC cities (2 issues)
Search pattern: Look for city.gov domains or official municipal GIS portals
Verification: District count should match known city council size

patternDetected.suburbanCitiesUsingMetroData: San Jacinto→Hemet, Walnut→West Covina, Menifee→Perris, Jacksonville Beach→Jacksonville
patternDetected.countiesBleedingIntoCities: Barberton→Summit County, Goose Creek→County, Bluffton→Beaufort County, Opelika→Lee County
patternDetected.regionalDataMislabeled: Poway→SDRVC regional, Winter Springs→73 district regional, Little Rock→BPADD regional

knoxville_tn.evidence: Explicit city name in layer, correct district count

nextSteps: 2. Manual investigation of 5 MEDIUM severity cities
3. Search for authoritative sources: city.gov/gis, official open data portals
4. Verify district counts against known city council sizes
5. Build allowlist of trusted org IDs vs suspicious regional IDs
6. Consider requiring self-hosted GIS servers (not services.arcgis.com) for production
